705765f-a.title: Brooklyn: Montague Street - Court Street
705765f-a.text:
Montague Street, south side, west from Fulton StreetC At the ex-
treme left, is the Continental Insurance Building, next to it the Old
Academy of Music, next to it the Academy of Design. The trolley tracks are
no longer on Montague Street. The clock on the right, was still keeping
time in (1936). This whole block has been renovated.
About 1890.
( .A..o 4e CoYT 6f.
Eugene L. Armbruster Colleotion.
NAY BE REPRODUCED.

705763f-a.title: Brooklyn: Montague Street - Court Street
705763f-a.text:
Montague Street, north side, at and west of Court Street. Note the
dress of the policemen.
1900.
Eugene L Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
705763f-a.folder: Montague Street & Court Street, Brooklyn, NY

703832f-a.title: Brooklyn: Court Street - Montague Street
703832f-a.text:
Court Street, west side, from Montague (right) to Remsen
Streets. On the extreme right is the Mechanics Bank Building
at the northwest corner of Court and Montague Streets. To the
left of it, at the S.W. corner of the two streets, is the Con-
tinental Insurance Building (narrow buildfng) and the Phoenix
Tnsurance Building. These two were torn down in 1926 and the
35-story Montague-Court Building erected on the site. The clear-
ance to the left of the Phoenix Building, which is the north-
west corner of Court and Remsen Streets, is the former site of
the Garfield Building, where the 29-story Court-Remsen Building
was later put up. The view is across Borough Hall Park from
Fulton Street. The statue (center left) is that of Henry Ward
Beecher, d'stinguished preacher of the Plymouth Church and
abolitionist.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection  1925
MAY BE REPRODUCED
703832f-a.folder: Court Street & Montague Street, Brooklyn, NY

703835f-a.title: Brooklyn: Court Street - Montague Street
703835f-a.text:
16-26 Court Street, west side, between Montague and Remsen Streets,
showing in the foreground, Borough Hall Park, and at the left part of the
Borough Hall Building.
May 1926.
Brown Brothers.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

703834f-a.title: Brooklyn: Court Street - Montague Street
703834f-a.text:
Court Street, south from and inclading Msntague Street.  In the
foreground is the Court Street Station of the Fulton Street B.M.T. Elevated
line. In the backgroand is seen the Sorough Hall Building, with ite
tower and clock; in back thereof is shown the new Municipal Building.
1928.

705764f-a.title: Brooklyn: Montague Street - Court Street
705764f-a.text:
Montague Street, north side, west from Court Street. At 197 is seen
The Montague Street branch of the Brooklyn Public Library. The building
was erected in 1867.
December 1925.
Brown Brothers.

705766f-a.title: Brooklyn: Montague Street - Court Street
705766f-a.text:
Montagde Street, south side, west from Court Street, showing a rear
view of the Academy of Musio, opened in 1861 at a cost of over 1200,000.
It was destroyed by fire in 1903. At the right, is the steeple of the
Church of the Holy Trinity. In the background is the Pierrepont Hotel.
1902.
Eugene L. Armbruater Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
